text:
The High Court of Karnataka on Thursday ordered issue of notice to M. Narayanaswamy, who was recently elected as member to the Karnataka Legislative Council from the Bengaluru Local Authorities’ constituency from the Congress.

Justice A.S. Bopanna passed the order on a petition filed by defeated candidate Doddabasavaraju (BJP), who questioned the legality of Mr. Narayanaswamy’s election.

The petitioner, who submitted a video in a compact disc to the High Court, claimed that the footage showed that some people were made to take oath that they would vote for the Congress candidate. It was also alleged in the petition that model/duplicate ballot papers were used to cast votes, thus impacting the sanctity of the election held in December 2015.
title: Karnataka HC notice to newly elected MLC
